text: Hi Avinab, did you get any response yet? I would continue to send occasional brief updates by email (once or twice a week, or when you have significant progress to report), assuming that the mentor will get back to you when they can. I can see you have  done the tests, so you might start working on the proposal (see the <https://github.com/rstats-gsoc/gsoc2023/wiki/application-template>). My only concern is that Neeraj is the only mentor listed for your project and GSoC projects should have 2, so it would be good to know if Neeraj recommends proceeding with a proposal (he has posted a few projects ideas). You might consider an alternative project otherwise if you haven't had a positive response from him soon.

text: Hi Ali! Thanks for your interest in this project. The next step would be to work on some of the tests to demonstrate your relevant skills and post your solutions on the project page.

elements.text: Hi Ali! Thanks for your interest in this project. The next step would be to work on some of the tests to demonstrate your relevant skills and post your solutions on the project page.

text:
Hey there,Heather! Thanks a lot for getting back ,I haven't heard from Neeraj as of yet .
 Have started working on the proposal and please do let me know if there is a need to switch to another project (I will start as soon as possible if that is the case).
Also I checked in with Prajwal,he is a mentor for another project in which Neeraj is a co mentor.
He told me that Neeraj is busy with his research work in Dubai hence he wasn't able to revert back.
Please do let me know if there are any other updates
Thanks a ton Heather!

text: I had a question regarding the second medium test case. should I explain how the proof-of-concept works in terms of vscode dev-containers or in terms of what exactly?
